p: Nine CBT-type cannabinoids, including (−)- trans-CBT-C 5 ( 87), (+)- trans-CBT-C 5 ( 88), (±)- cis-CBT-C 5 ( 89), (±)- trans-CBT-C 3 ( 90), CBT-C 3-homologue ( 91), (−)- trans-CBT-OEt-C 5 ( 92), (–)- trans-CBT-OEt-C 3 ( 93), 8,9-Di-OH-CBT-C 5 ( 94), and CBDA-C 5 9-OH-CBT-C 5 ester ( 95) ( Figure 6), have been isolated from cannabis. Cannabitriol ( 87) was originally reported in 1966 from Japanese hemp [ 28], but its chemical structure was elucidated in 1976 [ 54]. The configuration of this compound was later determined by X-ray analysis [ 55]. The compounds (+)- trans-CBT-C 5 ( 88) and (–)- trans -CBT-OEt-C 5 ( 92) were isolated by ElSohly et al. from the ethanolic extract of cannabis, which was chromatographed on a silica gel column [ 56] and identified by GCMS.
